intro: Pilosella myriadenia, commonly known as the many-flowered pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers that are arranged in dense clusters, giving it a fluffy appearance. Its leaves are typically grayish-green with a fuzzy texture, and it often grows in meadows and open woodlands. Pilosella myriadenia is known for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils and full sun conditions.
